p: Furthermore, all groups had similar protection levels, which were around 80% for all the influenza A subtypes tested. Altogether, these results showed that the Epimedium koreanum Nakai aqueous extract was strong to inhibit viral replication and promote the survival of mice against lethal infections of different subtypes of influenza A viruses. They suggested that oral administration of this aqueous extract has the potential as an effective herbal remedy for prophylaxis and therapeutic applications in both humans and livestock [ 111].
